metadata.title: Implement Patient Documents List/Upload API Routes

context.background: This task implements Implement Patient Documents List/Upload API Routes for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 40 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Follow the PRD architecture/security conventions and keep outputs compatible with the Healio design system and response envelopes.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Implement Patient Documents List/Upload API Routes in the planned files (healio/app/api/v1/patients/[id]/documents/route.ts, healio/services/documentService.ts) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.

Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/patients/:id/documents, POST /api/v1/patients/:id/documents) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Add or update focused tests (unit/integration) for critical business rules, idempotency, or security behavior introduced by this task.
Document assumptions and any follow-on schema/API contracts in code comments or lightweight docs when they affect downstream tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/patients/:id/documents, POST /api/v1/patients/:id/documents and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Validate security/tenant behavior with at least one negative test or rejection scenario when applicable.
Record evidence of persistence/side effects (DB row change, log entry, webhook event handling, cache behavior, etc.) as applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement Patient Documents List/Upload API Routes is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 3 API Endpoints) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
Business rules, tenant scoping, and security constraints relevant to this task are enforced (validation, idempotency, RBAC, webhook/cron protection, etc.).
At least one verification artifact (test case, curl call, or fixture-driven check) proves the new behavior works and regressions are covered.

execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented tenant-scoped GET/POST patient document routes with multipart upload parsing, patient existence checks, file-required validation, and standard error/success envelopes. Responses include signed preview/download URLs (15-minute expiry) by enriching stored document metadata via documentService, which supports the upcoming patient documents tab UI.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.

Route tests: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patient-documents-route.test.ts` passed; covers upload/list success, signed preview URL fields, unauthenticated rejection (401), invalid patient id (400), missing file (400), unsupported MIME (415), and tenant-scoped patient mismatch (404).

Persistence/side effects: in-memory document metadata/blob stores record uploaded documents and list ordering; GET/POST responses include `memory://signed/...` signed URLs via private-storage fallback in local test mode.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence records changed files/tests/screenshots as applicable.
